Patient Particulars: Name: Angela; Sex: Female; Marital status: Unmarried
Past Session Information: Follow up session: Patient was unhappy with her drinking issues and was maintaining better earlier.
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Sense of compulsion to take alcohol
2. Increased quantity of alcohol intake
3. Progressive neglect of alternate pleasures
4. Ideas of suicide
5. Ideas of unworthiness
History: Course: Fluctuating; Progress: Deteriorating; Perpetuating factor: Losing job; Present history: Patient was maintaining well until last session. She was resilient and had some goals to achieve. She used to consume alcohol and was seeking therapy meanwhile and was maintaining well until this week, when she reported losing her job and feeling worthless. She lives away from her family; Substance use history: She used to consume alcohol.
Current Mental Status Examination: Thought: Content- it reflected worry regarding losing her job and losing her house in near future & hopelessness; Mood: Dysphoric; Affect: Restricted; Judgement: Personal judgement impaired.
Psychotherapy Type: Type: Person Centered Therapy; Mode of therapy: Individual
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient recently lost her job and had been feeling difficulty to cope with her current phase. She finds it difficult to manage her expenses and has been relying on alcohol for even basic functioning. She also mentioned about her suicidal ideations
Reflections by the therapist: Patient was careful of her actions before and had certain goals on life she wanted to achieve. Until this session, she had taken a negativistic turn towards her life where she seemed careless and totally hopeless for her future due to which she had made an active plan to commit suicide.
Clinical Diagnosis by Reviewer: Dependence syndrome comorbid with Depressive episode
Next session details: Crisis Intervention, Patient will be admitted.
